The 5th Day of Christmas

355 words written on Wed, Dec 29 2004

Personas:

One of the main issues with social software as we‚Äôve known it is the fact that they treat you as if you have one face you show to the entire world. In Real Life, we present nuanced ‚Äúversions‚Äù of ourselves to different people, determined by context, trust, etc. We make interaction-specific decisions about how much information we‚Äôre going to reveal about ourselves, and we behave differently in different circles. We wanted a social software that took more of Real Life into account, and this was the key ‚Äúmissing ingredient‚Äù we saw. Sure, I can have Friendster for my ‚Äúhook up‚Äù profile, LinkedIn for my ‚Äúprofessional‚Äù profile, MyPlace for my ‚Äúband dude‚Äù profile, Orkut for my ‚Äúcatch all‚Äù profile‚Ä¶but what a pain in the proverbial bum. What if there was one online social tool that let me interact within all my various communities in a realistic and nuanced way? Hopefully SmartCommons is coming close‚Ä¶

Setting up Personas:<ul><li>Under your picture there are buttons for ‚ÄúEdit Profile‚Äù and ‚ÄúEdit Personas‚Äù ‚Ä¶click on ‚ÄúEdit Personas‚Äù in case that wasn‚Äôt entirely obvious!</li><li>Enter a name for your new Persona and hit ‚ÄúCreate new persona.‚Äù</li><li>Now you can specify which pieces of your ‚Äúcore‚Äù profile you share from this Persona. Notice that you still use the same profile information, you just expose more or less of it. You are still the same person (you can‚Äôt create a ‚Äúpersona‚Äù that is actually a fake identity‚Ä¶you‚Äôd need a new account for that‚Ä¶heheh), you are just using more finesse in how you present yourself within your different social circles.</li></ul>There are some really cool things we plan on doing with Personas in the future*, tying them to personal content management so that you can safely and centrally publish stratified content specific to your Personas‚Ä¶but I don‚Äôt want to get ahead of myself‚Ä¶

Other people talking about the 12 Days of Christmas: miniette and jonny baker.

*Should pigs flying overhead begin to crap money upon us.
